MacroOp.Name: OMNI_INFINITE_TIMEOUT
MacroOp.Description: A framework constant that defines the infinite timeout used when joining a thread or waiting for a specific object. Defined as such: @code #if defined(OMNI_OS_WIN) #define OMNI_INFINITE_TIMEOUT INFINITE #else #define OMNI_INFINITE_TIMEOUT 0xFFFFFFFF #endif @code
MacroOp.PlatformSpecific: On Windows based platforms this is a synonym for the @c INFINITE macro defined in @c WinBase.h and on other platforms it is defined as the @c INFINITE macro is (that of a max @c DWORD value of @c 0xFFFFFFFF)
MacroOp.Synopsis: Defines the infinite timeout value used for waiting on a thread.
